00101 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00102  * Classes
00103  */
00104 
00109 class windows_resource_bundle
00110 {
00113 public:
00115     typedef ff_char_t                       char_type;
00117     typedef std::basic_string<char_type>    string_type;
00119     typedef windows_resource_bundle         class_type;
00121     class missing_resource_id_exception
00122         : public bundle_exception
00123     {
00124     public: // Member Types
00126         typedef bundle_exception                    parent_class_type;
00128         typedef missing_resource_id_exception       class_type;
00130         typedef parent_class_type::string_type      string_type;
00131 
00132     public: // Construction
00137         explicit missing_resource_id_exception(int id)
00138             : parent_class_type(create_message_(NULL, 0u, id, NULL).c_str())
00139             , id(id)
00140             , code(-1)
00141         {
00142             FASTFORMAT_COVER_MARK_ENTRY();
00143         }
00155         missing_resource_id_exception(char const* msg, DWORD code, ff_char_t const* id, ff_char_t const* resourceType)
00156             : parent_class_type(create_message_(msg, code, reinterpret_cast<int>(id), resourceType).c_str())
00157             , id(reinterpret_cast<int>(id))
00158             , code(code)
00159         {
00160             FASTFORMAT_COVER_MARK_ENTRY();
00161         }
00173         missing_resource_id_exception(char const* msg, DWORD code, int id, ff_char_t const* resourceType)
00174             : parent_class_type(create_message_(msg, code, id, resourceType).c_str())
00175             , id(id)
00176             , code(code)
00177         {
00178             FASTFORMAT_COVER_MARK_ENTRY();
00179         }
00180 
00181     private:
00183         class_type& operator =(class_type const&);
00184 
00185     public: // Attributes
00187         const int   id;
00189         const DWORD code;
00190 
00191     private:
00192         static multibyte_string_type create_message_(char const* msg, DWORD code, int id, ff_char_t const* resourceType)
00193         {
00194             static const char       string0[]   =   "could not load bundle resource corresponding to identifier ";
00195             static const char       string1[]   =   ": ";
00196             char                    num_[21];
00197             char const*             num         =   stlsoft::integer_to_string(&num_[0], STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(num_), id);
00198             winstl::error_desc_a    reason(code);
00199             multibyte_string_type   message;
00200 
00201             if(0 != code)
00202             {
00203                 message.reserve(STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(string0) + 21 + STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(string1) + reason.size());
00204             }
00205             else
00206             {
00207                 message.reserve(STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(string0) + 21);
00208             }
00209 
00210             message += string0;
00211             message += num;
00212 
00213             if(0 != code)
00214             {
00215                 message += string1;
00216                 message += reason;
00217             }
00218 
00219             return message;
00220         }
00221     };
00222     typedef missing_resource_id_exception   exception_type;
00223 private:
00224     typedef winstl::basic_resource_string<
00225         string_type
00226     ,   stlsoft::throw_exception_policy<exception_type>
00227     >                                       resource_string_type_;
00229 
00232 public:
00233     explicit windows_resource_bundle(HINSTANCE hinst);
00234     ~windows_resource_bundle() throw();
00235 private:
00236     windows_resource_bundle(class_type const&);
00237     class_type& operator =(class_type const&);
00239 
00242 public:
00243     string_type operator [](int id) const throw(missing_resource_id_exception);
00245 
00248 private:
00250 
00253 private:
00254     HINSTANCE   m_instance;
00256 };
00257 
00258 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00259  * Namespace
00260  */
00261 
00262 #ifndef FASTFORMAT_DOCUMENTATION_SKIP_SECTION
00263 
00264 inline /* explicit */ windows_resource_bundle::windows_resource_bundle(HINSTANCE hinst)
00265     : m_instance(hinst)
00266 {}
00267 
00268 inline windows_resource_bundle::~windows_resource_bundle() throw()
00269 {
00270     ::FreeLibrary(m_instance);
00271 }
00272 
00273 inline windows_resource_bundle::string_type windows_resource_bundle::operator [](int id) const throw(windows_resource_bundle::missing_resource_id_exception)
00274 {
00275     resource_string_type_   str(m_instance, id);
00276     string_type             s2 = str;
00277 
00278     // Now we attempt some "smarts" by looking to see if
00279     //
00280     // 1. it contains no {D} replacement parameters, where D is a digit
00281     // 2. it contains one or more %D replacement parameters, where D is a digit
00282     //
00283     // If BOTH of these conditions are true, then it assumes that this is an
00284     // MFC / message resource file, and to do the following transformations:
00285     //
00286     // a. all { instances are to be replaced with {{
00287     // b. all %D parameters are to be replaced with {D}
00288 
00289     if( 0 == fastformat::util::calculate_number_of_fastformat_replacement_parameters(s2.data(), s2.length()) &&
00290         0 != fastformat::util::calculate_number_of_windows_replacement_parameters(s2.data(), s2.length()))
00291     {
00292         s2 = fastformat::util::escape_fastformat_replacement_parameters(s2);
00293 
00294         s2 = fastformat::util::change_windows_replacement_parameters_to_fastformat(s2);
00295     }
00296 
00297     return s2;
00298 }
